title: is ece worth it at pes?
content: I am interested in electronics itself so I was wondering if ece is good at pes, I mostly just hear about cs related info regarding pes hence I am posting this as a question

comments.body: If you're not getting ece anywhere better it's good.

If you are interested in Electronics, then PES Is not the right place for it. ECE is the worst branch to join in PES. Try other colleges if you badly want ECE. 

PES Is known for CSE and CSE-AIML. Please try to join CSE
How are placements in ece
And can you change your branch from ece to cse in pes
yes
What are the requirements tho

It is bad.

Basically, you need really good CGPA
Thanks for this
bro can u give this year cse placements stats
is PES good for biotechnology
The comment explicitly mentions: CS branches only.

You need a 10gpa by the end of first year, the chances are less likely. It depends on the number of empty seats left in cs so if there are 3 seats in cs and you're the 4th person with a 10gpa you ain't getting it.
Yeah sure, Will search.

This is the last year cgpa based branch change cutoffs

Rr cs, 9.6
Rr aiml, 8.2
Ec cs, 7.4

It is exclusively based on cgpa your current branch doesn't matter
So if i score above 7.4 in ec campus I can change my branch to cs?

If you score above 7.4 in any branch in any campus, you can change your branch to cs in ec campus. 

But that was only for last year, it can vary by any amount. It depends on the number of vacant seats and how many people are willing to change branch

If you are truly interested in ECE, it's decent in PES.
 It's gonna be academically intensive but if you're up for a good challenge, yes it's good. 
The ECE syllabus in PES is infact better than colleges under VTU.
Wait, so you can go from ec to rr via branch change?
Anywhere from anywhere. As long as it's an engineering branch and as long as there's a seat vacancy
Oh! Thanks.
I remember choosing ece as my top preference when registering, would it be possible to choose cse instead while counselling?

while I am interested in ece, I keep hearing how there are little to no internships and that ece students have to sit for IT companies for placements too, I am worried that even after learning electronics, if I end up in somewhere like tcs what would be the point

Yes that kinda is the sad reality but if you're really interested in the subject, i don't think you'd want to worry much about placements, getting an ece core job is very difficult indeed but you'll get there eventually. 
One key tip: Don't ever compare yourself to your CSE peers. 
Career graph for an ECE major who sticks to core electronics is a gradual one, so don't be in a rush
Not sure, check with admission office
